common_issues.title: Pieces Assistant Vague Response Bug
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Assistant responding with vague promises of future solutions instead of actionable responses. This occurs after approximately 20 requests in a session.  The issue has been observed on macOS with Pieces OS versions 11.2.1 and 11.2.2. No solutions have been identified yet.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Missing Files in Context After 11 Requests

**Key Points:**

* User `seantiz` reported a bug where files are missing in the context after 11 requests and 11 responses.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the proper Pieces team member.
* The user was unable to provide further information to reproduce the bug.

**Problems Identified:**

* Files are missing from the context after a certain number of requests/responses, potentially affecting user workflows.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No specific solution is proposed in the conversation. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been acknowledged and routed to the relevant team.
* Further investigation and resolution are pending. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided links to related issues and resources may be helpful for further investigation.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Conversation Summary: 

**Key Points:**

* Users on M3 Macs experienced PiecesOS running in "basic mode due to device constraints," resulting in missing Workstream Activity and LTM updates.
* The issue was reported by `hra42`, `joelash`, and `bartonfriedland`.
* `aalfath` found that closing and opening PiecesOS resolved the problem.
* `mark-at-pieces` confirmed a bug and promised a fix in the next version.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS ran in "basic mode" on M3 Macs, disabling features like Workstream Activity and LTM updates.
* No clear explanation for this behavior was provided in the documentation.
* An "Unknown Origin" element appeared in the telemetry browser, raising concerns.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Restarting PiecesOS temporarily resolved the issue.
* `mark-at-pieces` promised a fix in the next PiecesOS version.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is acknowledged and a fix is planned for the next PiecesOS version.
* Users can currently use the temporary workaround of restarting PiecesOS.
* The "Unknown Origin" element remains unexplained.

**Additional Notes:**

* `mark-at-pieces` offered to elaborate on "basic mode" and its limitations.
* `bartonfriedland` requested clarification on the timing of the fix and the "Unknown Origin" element.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users reported significant slowness in the copilot experience after the latest updates.
* The issue manifested as a hang on the "..." loading indicator after sending a message.
* High CPU usage and blocked responses were also observed.

**Problems Identified:**

* A bug in the copilot experience caused a websocket to not reinitialize correctly after a hard reset.
* High CPU usage and context file reading issues contributed to the slowness.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix for the websocket issue was released in Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2.
* Version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app contained significant performance improvements.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Some users reported the issue to be resolved after the updates.
* Others, including navdeepdev459, still experience lag.

**Next Steps:**

* Investigating the cause of the ongoing lag for some users.
* Providing support to users experiencing issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including slow performance, unresponsiveness, and error messages. These issues often arise after updates. Solutions include patch releases, app updates, and troubleshooting steps like hard resets. However, some users continue to experience problems despite these efforts.

related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.0.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When copy paste code sencond time in Ask anything give error  this message is empty please try again
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Pieces Desktop Error

**Key Points Raised:**

- Users are unable to send messages in the Pieces Desktop app.
- The error message "Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again show error pieces desktop" appears.
- The issue affects both Mac and Windows versions of the app.
- The issue appeared after updating to the latest version.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Pieces Support Bot suggested related issues and resources.
- Pieces team member (@mack-at-pieces) announced a patch release to resolve the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The patch release has been deployed and the issue is resolved.
- Users are able to send messages again.

**Additional Notes:**

- The conversation took place in March 2025.
- Multiple users reported the issue.
- The Pieces team responded promptly and addressed the problem efficiently.

common_issues.title: Pieces Extension and Desktop App Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces web extension and desktop app failing to connect, often with console errors due to port conflicts. Solutions include bug fixes in updates, disabling conflicting features, and ensuring both Pieces OS and applications are updated. Real-time support may be needed for diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension messing out stackoverflow
related_issues.text:
Chrome Extension messing out stackoverflow
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

It fills this text endlessly...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6b5edb10-b7cf-4fa6-a523-aa73af94cbee)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Luceat-lux-vestra reported an issue where PWE embed buttons were not working correctly on a specific website.

**Problems Identified:**

* Issue caused by conflicting functionality with the embedding functionality of the website.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Rutvik-at-pieces suggested disabling embed buttons for the specific page, as this was the only known workaround.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Luceat-lux-vestra confirmed that disabling embed buttons resolved the issue.
* Rutvik-at-pieces closed the issue and documented the workaround for future reference.

**Overall, the conversation demonstrated effective collaboration between user and support representative to identify and address the issue.**

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key points raised:** * Pieces OS dynamically changes its port, making it difficult to find with a static port check. * This leads to failed API calls and error messages flooding the developer console. * Although privacy is respected, these errors are invasive and hinder workflow. **Problems identified:** * Failed API calls due to dynamic port changes. * Error messages cluttering the developer console. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * Proposed: * Hiding or better handling errors from inactive port checks. * Addressing the issue for better user experience. * Implemented: * Fix for dynamic port checks implemented in a patch update. * Chrome bug workaround identified. * Option to hide network messages in dev console suggested. * Latest web extension version (4.0.4) released with the fix. **Current status/outcome:** * The issue is fixed in the latest web extension version (4.0.4), addressing the dynamic port checks and error messages. * While Chrome bug might persist, a workaround and alternative solution are provided. **Additional notes:** * User privacy is not compromised by the failed API calls. * The solution acknowledges the user experience concerns and provides a satisfactory resolution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Startup Conflicts
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts when Pieces OS launches alongside other applications, particularly Ollama server. This often manifests as CUDA errors or high CPU usage. Solutions include managing startup order, ensuring Ollama is externally launched first, and updating to the latest Pieces OS version for potential race condition fixes.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama server installation issues with Pieces OS

**Key points raised:**

* User @johnkennyuk experiencing issues with Ollama server installation on Pieces OS.
* Cuda errors related to cublas64_12.dll were encountered.
* Multiple uninstall and reinstall attempts were made, including via winget and OllamaSetup.exe.
* Potential conflict between Pieces OS and Ollama server startup order was suspected.

**Problems identified:**

* Broken Ollama installation due to winget installation error.
* Conflicting Ollama server instances running simultaneously.
* Race condition between Pieces OS and Ollama server startup causing errors.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Uninstalling Ollama via winget and reinstalling with OllamaSetup.exe.
* Investigating potential incomplete installations and corrupted files.
* Modifying startup order by delaying Pieces OS launch on sign-in.
* Implementing changes in Pieces OS version 11.1.2 to address potential race condition.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue appears to be resolved after updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.2.
* User will continue monitoring and report any further issues.

**Additional notes:**

* User acknowledged the helpfulness of the developer's responses and collaboration in troubleshooting the issue.
* The developer expressed willingness to provide further assistance if needed.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Author:** pieces-support-bot (bot)

**Date:** 2025-03-14

**Key Points Raised:**

* New issue submitted by user @bpluly.
* Issue automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate Pieces team member.
* User might find related issues helpful (links provided).
* User encouraged to explore additional resources for support.

**Problems Identified:**

* Issue content not disclosed.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Issue triaged and routed for investigation.
* Recommendations for related issues and resources provided.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User waiting for follow-up from Pieces team member.

**Additional Notes:**

* The summary focuses on the most important details provided in the conversation, highlighting the key points raised, problems identified, and actions taken. 
* The specific nature of the user's issue remains unknown. 
* The outcome of the ticket is currently pending.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update and Launch Issues on Windows
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues updating and launching Pieces OS on Windows.  This is potentially caused by App Installer bugs or false positive virus detections from antivirus software like Kaspersky.  Suggested solutions include updating App Installer and configuring antivirus software to allow Pieces OS.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Windows users unable to launch Pieces OS due to App Installer bug. Some users experience Trojan warnings from antivirus software (Kaspersky).

**Key Points:**

* User [@ThatRendle] reported the issue.
* Bot suggested related issues and resources.
* [@nathan-courtney-pieces] identified the App Installer bug and suggested updating App Installer.
* User [@bejokun] reported the Trojan warning.
* [@nathan-courtney-pieces] suggested configuring Kaspersky to allow Pieces OS.
* [@bejokun] questioned the need to allow a "Trojan".

**Problems Identified:**

* App Installer bug on Windows preventing Pieces OS launch.
* Kaspersky antivirus falsely detecting Pieces OS as a Trojan.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update App Installer.
* Configure Kaspersky to allow Pieces OS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear if the App Installer bug is resolved.
* [@bejokun] did not confirm if allowing Pieces OS in Kaspersky resolved the issue.

**Next Steps:**

* Investigate the App Installer bug further.
* Collaborate with antivirus software companies to address false positives.

recommendations: "Investigate and address the root cause of Pieces Assistant's vague responses, particularly after extended sessions."
"Prioritize resolving performance issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including slowness, unresponsiveness, and error messages."
"Improve communication to users regarding Pieces OS updates, including potential conflicts with antivirus software and App Installer issues."
"Develop clearer documentation and user guidance on managing Pieces OS startup alongside other applications, especially Ollama server, to prevent conflicts."
"Investigate and address the reasons behind Pieces web extension and desktop app connectivity problems, focusing on port conflicts and console errors."
